title.narrative: Envelope 1: Provide life-saving assistance to affected population through provision of comprehensive WASH services

description.narrative:
In response to longer-term solutions to the provision of water supply, and other critical sanitation and hygiene services of the affected populations in North-West Syria to reinforce the most urgent life-saving interventions, Amal Organization aims to enhance the long-term WASH infrastructure. This intervention targets both host communities and IDPs in Sarmin sub-district which is considered a highly prioritized and underserved area that is facing multiple challenges in light of unseasonably low levels of rainfall as well as sanitation services. thus, the planned intervention will respond to the needs of 13546 individual (1610 IDPs, 11936 residents, including (2303 men, 3047 women, 3726 boys and 4470 girls) through the following activities:
- Establishment of wastewater treatment plant (Anaerobic Baffled Reactor ABR) based on attached WBD report. This component will benefit the whole community through reducing water borne diseases which will be improving the public health situation as well as using the treated wastewater for irrigation purposes for the local farmers. In consequence, the whole community will benefit from this component. - Expansion and rehabilitation of sewerage networks in Sarmin, to ensure safe access to sanitation infrastructure for the whole community members both IDPs and host communities. - Supporting the regular solid waste management through providing salaries for 20 workers, operation, and maintenance (OampM) for current vehicles, distribution of 30 big garbage bins, and cleaning equipment. This component will benefit the whole community 13546 individual (1610 IDPs, 11936 residents, including (2303 men, 3047 women, 3726 boys and 4470 girls).
- Rehabilitation and maintenance of existing latrines, showers as well as heating of bath spaces using solar system for tow collective centers which will be used for lightening too, in addition to providing 44 water tanks for the IDPs families residing in the collective centers. This will benefit 28 HHs in the first collective center and 16 HHs in the second center .
- Control of the spread of COVID-19 through RCCE and provision of soap for hand washing for 7560 individuals among the most vulnerable and subjected to infection focusing on PWD, elderly , PLW, women-headed households and those who have chronical diseases and children in the schools who mainly transmit infection to their families.
Consequently, the aforementioned components will help the affected population in Sarmin community to avoid adaption of negative coping strategies in terms of having access to safe water and other critical sanitation services, and they will directly feed the WASH cluster objectives through support to water, sanitation/sewage, and solid waste management systems to ensure regular services for affected people.
